nodes.bodyText: Ah, that slipped in here by copy pasting it from the showcase.. let me fix it there as well
Check your spacing here it looks like this line needs 2 more space indent.
I already fixed my setting this weekend. Will fix this one.
JSDoc this method what it returns and why you are only returning first 10 chars.

Maybe call it toISOString(date)

I'll rename it to toISODateString and add documentation. Basically we just care about the date part here and not about the time, so I'm taking only the date part.
I did not bother writing them. It's how they were generated by NetBeans.
Ahh mine above were generated by Eclipse.  Interesting!
OK cool yeah its juts that Objects.hash() already does all the magic inside of it so its strange Netbeans generates like that.
